ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 0: PRE-OPERATIONAL (SHIFT) INSPECTION
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: You will be asked to identify five items on the crane that are part of the pre-operational inspection.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 0: PRE-OPERATIONAL (SHIFT) INSPECTION
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription: You have approximately one minute per item.
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: One at a time, you will be asked to describe how you would conduct the inspection and what deficiencies you would look for.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PLACE LOAD HOOK AND CHAIN IN STOP CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: At the Examiner's indication to start at which point time will begin,raise the load hook and chain at least 10 ft. off the ground to clear all obstacles and personnel.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PLACE LOAD HOOK AND CHAIN IN STOP CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Bring it from its starting position in the Start Circle to the Stop Circle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PLACE LOAD HOOK AND CHAIN IN STOP CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once the load hook and chain reach the Stop Circle place it there such that the chain suspended from the hook makes contact with the ground inside the circle and remains there.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PLACE LOAD HOOK AND CHAIN IN STOP CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Once the chain makes contact with the ground inside the circle, you are not permitted to lift the chain off the ground.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PLACE LOAD HOOK AND CHAIN IN STOP CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: The Examiner will give you a stop signal once the load hook and chain are under control.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 1: PLACE LOAD HOOK AND CHAIN IN STOP CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-    Dragging or contact of chain outside of the circle.
-    Load hook touching ground either inside or outside of the circle.
-    Load hook or chain contacting any part of the course (e.g., poles).
-    Lifting the chain off the ground after it has made contact with the ground inside the circle.
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: PLACE TEST WEIGHT IN LOAD CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: At the Examiner’s indication to start at which point timing will begin, bring the Test Weight from the Start Circle to the Load Circle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: PLACE TEST WEIGHT IN LOAD CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Swing, trolley or hoist as necessary to place the est Weight on the ground completely within the Load Circle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: PLACE TEST WEIGHT IN LOAD CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: The Examiner will then five the hoist and swing signal and this will indicate that you should then hoist and swing to place the Test Weight on the ground in the Start Circle.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: PLACE TEST WEIGHT IN LOAD CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Do not let any part of the Test Weight make contact with the PVC barriers that surround the Load and Star Circles.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: PLACE TEST WEIGHT IN LOAD CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Timing will end when you have placed the Test Weight on the ground in the Start circle.  Task is not complete until the load is placed completely within the outside perimeter of the circle ad the Examiner has given you a stop signal.  If the Examiner has not given you a stop signal, this will indicate that the weight is not within the circle and the task continues to be timed.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 2: PLACE TEST WEIGHT IN LOAD CIRCLE
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-    Knocking ball off pole.
-    Knocking pole over.
-    Exceeding the optimum time.
-    Hitting any part of the course.
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: NEGOTIATE ZIGZAG CORRIDOR WITH LOAD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: This task is divided into two tasks 3A and 3B. 3A requires you to go through the corridor in a forward direction. 3B requires you to go though the corridor in a reverse direction.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: NEGOTIATE ZIGZAG CORRIDOR WITH LOAD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: At the Examiner’s direction to start at which point timing will begin, lift the Test Weight into the and swing, trolley or hoist up or down as you judge necessary to guide the load through the Zigzag corridor without touching the ground with the Test Weight, or raising the Test Weight so high that the chains leave the ground, or knocking over any part of the PVC barrier.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: NEGOTIATE ZIGZAG CORRIDOR WITH LOAD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription:
-    Knocking ball off pole
-    Moving pole base off line
-    Knocking pole over
-    Chain leaving ground
-    Load touching ground
-    Circumventing the task
-    Exceeding the optimum time (3 minutes each direction)
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Points will be deducted for the following:

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: NEGOTIATE ZIGZAG CORRIDOR WITH LOAD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription: The Proctor will then detach the Test Weight from the load hook.
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Timing stops when you have placed the Test Weight on the ground in the Stop Circle and the Examiner has given you a stop signal.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 3: NEGOTIATE ZIGZAG CORRIDOR WITH LOAD
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeDescription: Remain in the cab or at the operator’s station until the Examiner gives you a clear indication that you may leave. Set the swing brake and lock before leaving.
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: At the Examiner’s direction, swing the load hook to the Start Circle and allow the Examiner to attach the chain in readiness for the next candidate.

ceterms:assesses.ceterms:frameworkName: PRACTICAL EXAM TASK 4: SAFE SECURING PROCEDURES
ceterms:assesses.ceterms:targetNodeName: Describe the procedures you would follow to secure the crane at the end of the work day.

ceterms:assessmentExampleDescription:
The Practical Exam tasks are:

    Task: Pre-Operational (Shift) Inspection
    Task 1: Place Load Hook and Chain in Stop Circle
    Task 2: Place Test Weight in Load Circle
    Task 3: Negotiate Zigzag Corridor With Load
    Task 4: Safe Securing Procedures

There is also a Pre-Test Briefing, a Pre-Test Familiarization Period, and a Pre-Task Familiarization Period (prior to the Load Circle task) with a load. You will be required to complete all phases of the test in sequence.
ceterms:assessmentOutput: All candidates receive score reports of their performance. Examination results are mailed to candidates approximately 12 business days after the receipt of Practical Examination score sheets by NCCCO. Both the Practical Examination and the scoring system have been validated and verified by NCCCO’s pilot testing program. A score of 70 represents the minimum passing score for the CCO Tower Crane Practical Examination.
ceterms:description: The CCO Tower Crane Practical Examination demonstrating crane operator proficiency may be taken on the following crane types: (1) Hammerhead; (2) Luffer; (3) Self-Erecting. An optimum time limit has been set for all tasks and is stated as part of the task descriptions. If the task is completed within this time period, there is no time penalty. Once the optimum time has been exceeded, candidates lose points on a gradual basis. If a candidate take one and a half times as long as the optimum time, he/she will have lost all the points allotted to that particular task. At two times the optimum time the Examiner may end the task and move on to the next task.

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:paymentPattern: CCO Tower Crane Operator Practical Exam (new candidates)

ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:name: CCO Tower Crane Operator Practical Exam
ceterms:estimatedCost.ceterms:paymentPattern: Tower Crane Operator Practical Exam (current CCO-certified Mobile Crane Operators or new candidates who are registering for Mobile Crane Operator exams at same time)

ceterms:name: CCO Tower Crane Operator Practical Exam
